jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)prior knowledge of possible dangers or problems gives one a tactical advantage
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)凡事预则立；情报有如武装

entry.def: If you forewarn someone about something, you warn them in advance that it is going to happen.

example.ex: The Macmillan Guide had forewarned me of what to expect.
example.tran: 《麦克米伦指南》已经事先告诫过我会遇到什么情况。

means.word_mean: 1. warn in advance or beforehand; give an early warning;

sentences.sentence: "I forewarned him of the trouble that would arise if he showed up at his ex-wife's house"

auth_sentence.content: They might, for example, need to forewarn about certain serious injuries.
auth_sentence.res_content: They might, for example, need to forewarn about certain serious injuries.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They might, for example, need to forewarn about certain serious injuries.

auth_sentence.content: We may not be able to do much about it, but it does forewarn us.
auth_sentence.res_content: We may not be able to do much about it, but it does forewarn us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We may not be able to do much about it, but it does forewarn us.
